author: Corbin McGuire corbin@emporia.com
title: Olpe wins 4th straight, tops Oswego 40-6
text:
Olpe wins 4th straight, tops Oswego 40-6 By Corbin McGuire corbin@emporia.com emporiagazette.com | 0 comments 
Olpe scored two early touchdowns en route to a 40-6 road win against Oswego Friday night. 
Andrew Burenheide, who scored two touchdowns, both in the first half, busted in for a 1-yard score and the Eagles’ defense followed it by recovering a fumble in the Indians’ own territory. 
Olpe wasted no time after the turnover, as Ryker Schmidt connected with Brady Scheidegger on a 34-yard touchdown on the first play of the drive to take control of the game. 
“I thought the first quarter we came out and did a good job,” Olpe head coach Chris Schmidt said. “We kind of had them on their heels.” 
Schmidt’s defense stifled Oswego’s attack nearly all game, allowing barely anything in the first half. 
“Defensively I think they may have only had one first down in the first half,” Schmidt said. “Our defense was pretty solid in the first half.” 
The Eagles got two short touchdown runs from Scheidegger and Ryker Schmidt in the third quarter. Schmidt finished the scoring off on a 8-yard pass to Ethan Moyer in the fourth quarter. 
Where the Eagles struggled was holding onto the ball, with four turnovers keeping them from firing on all cylinders. 
“We did what we needed to do. We weren’t real smooth,” Schmidt said. “We’d been doing a pretty good job with turnovers, but that hurt us offensively. Defense, I think was pretty stout for the most part.” 
Olpe improved to 4-2 on the season and 2-0 in district play. The Eagles host a tough test in Lyndon next Friday. 
“They’re a good team. They do a lot of things really well,” Schmidt said. “It’ll be a good ballgame.” 
Olpe 14 7 13 6 — 40 
Oswego 0 0 0 6 — 6
